publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5824 Ken Macintosh: BA Applied Music Course at University of Strathclyde—That the Parliament is concerned to learn of proposals to end the Bachelor of Arts in Applied Music course at the University of Strathclyde; believes that this degree is one of the most sought after in Scotland, with around 13 applicants for every place; considers that the course has helped to produce some of Scotland’s most talented musicians; highlights the vital role played by music and the arts in Scottish society and the support given by Scotland’s universities to encourage and develop talented artists of all disciplines; understands that many of Scotland’s music teachers graduated from this course; believes that it is important to have talented music specialists in schools, and supports the ongoing campaign to save the BA in Applied Music course at the University of Strathclyde. Supported by: Pauline McNeill*
